channel.title: Packet Expert
channel.description:
Well i have found a game in java (not runescape) that i would like to attempt to hack via packet editing. I know how to program java so i am not a complete noob, i am just a bit new to packets. My plan would be to find out what port the game uses. Then intercepting the packets it sends, then editing them and resending them. Or possible duplicating a certain packet and sending it over and over again. Would this be possible? If anyone knows how, can give me some tips, point me in the direction of the answers to my questions, or help out please post.
You can also add me on msn hurrisoft@hotmail.com
Thanks, Avalanche

item.title: Packet Expert
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

There’s NmapFE for Linux, and there are web based versions, but nothing beats a command prompt for impressing the noobs As for writing your own Nmap, yeah fucking right.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Expert
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:16, topic:138086”]Hm… It couldn’t be that hard, intercept, ask if you want to modify before sending back, or what you want to send back, or just leave, or maybe just listen for packets… and count idk cant be that hard[/quote]Let’s see you try and make then it if it can’t be that hard.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Expert
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

pizza pie:

Rofl, is that actually nmap?

Sure is.

Nmap was featured in The Matrix Reloaded! We have all seen many movies like Hackers which pass off ridiculous 3D animated eye-candy scenes as hacking. So I was shocked to find that Trinity does it properly in The Matrix Reloaded. She whips out Nmap version 2.54BETA25, uses it to find a vulnerable SSH server, and then proceeds to exploit it using the SSH1 CRC32 exploit from 2001

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Expert
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:139455”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=189767.msg1724035#msg1724035 date=1188714934]

Well i went to wpepro.net to download it and i did…but when i did my firewall detected a trogan and something else in it and deleted it. Is this a clean download link? or did my firewall mistake it

Anti viruses pick up packet sniffers / editors as ‘unwanted programs’ and sometimes even trojans to prevent people using them, it won’t harm your computer in any way.

Yeah, it’s silly how they do that. Fyodor made an article about how one of the anti virus scanners detects nmap, even though it’s entirely safe and he has contacted them about it.

Even Trinity in the Matrix uses nmap. >.<
[/quote]
[/quote]
Rofl, is that actually nmap?

Read full topic

Yeah, the file is clean. It’s the most widely used packet sniffer/editor for windows.
